title: Week 1: Course Intro and Data Science Toolbox
text:
Objectives

Think critically about data and its visual representations
Distinguish between visualization for data exploration vs. presentation
Manipulate/arrange/transform different kinds of data into forms conducive to visualization
Evaluate purposes and audiences for your visualizations
Explore how viz fits into larger rubric of data science
Develop both static and dynamic visualizations
Become comfortable with tools enabling all of the above

title: Week 1: Course Intro and Data Science Toolbox
text:
Key Tools

Git
GitHub
R and ggplot2
Python
D3.js

title: DSAN 5200: Advanced Data Visualization
text:
This page hosts Prof. Jeff’s slides for Section 03 of DSAN 5200-03: Advanced Data Visualization, Georgetown University, Spring 2024. The section takes place on Tuesdays from 12:30pm to 3:00pm in Car Barn, Room 309. All other materials for the course can be found on the main course webpage!
